intro: Pachylobus ferrugineus, commonly known as the rusty pachylobus, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and showy, pinkish-red flowers. The plant typically grows in humid, tropical environments and is often found in forest understories. Its leaves are elliptical and covered with a fine, rusty-colored pubescence, giving it its common name. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations.
